predicate.note: Frames file for 'dawn' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

example.name: both arguments
example.text: It [*EXP*-1] suddenly dawns on Mr. Hammack that [*] rebuilding the house in Los Gatos , an affluent community in Santa Clara County , may cost more than Aetna 's policy will pay [*?*] .
example.arg: that [*] rebuilding the house in Los Gatos , an affluent community in Santa Clara County , may cost more than Aetna 's policy will pay [*?*]

roleset.name: to begin to become light in the morning

example.name: intransitive
example.text: With a new day dawning on the sport , Mr. Jones does n't see a place for this sort of luxury .
